intro: Craspedia robusta, commonly known as the robust craspedia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are erect and can reach up to 1 meter in height. Craspedia robusta is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
